block.p: Jara Slade Baff, a daughter of Ava Baff and Dr. Steven Baff of New York, was married last evening to Scott David Shapiro, the son of Lynn Shapiro of Miami. Rabbi David Lincoln officiated at the 200 Fifth Club in New York.
Mr. and Mrs. Shapiro graduated from Washington University in St. Louis.

Jara Slade Baff, a daughter of Ava Baff and Dr. Steven Baff of New York, was married last evening to Scott David Shapiro, the son of Lynn Shapiro of Miami. Rabbi David Lincoln officiated at the 200 Fifth Club in New York.
Mr. and Mrs. Shapiro graduated from Washington University in St. Louis.

The bride, 26, is a program associate at the Pollock-Krasner Foundation, an organization in New York that provides financial assistance to artists. Her father, a podiatrist, retired from a New York practice and directs the medical advisory board for home health care of the Young Adult Institute for People with Disabilities in New York.

The bridegroom, 27, is a candidate for a Ph.D. in cell biology and an M.D. at the Albert Einstein College of Medicine, from which he received a master's degree in cell biology. He is the board treasurer of CitiWide, a charitable organization that provides services to people with AIDS. His mother is an events planner in Miami.
